entry.title: in fiction, neutron stars (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in fiction, neutron stars (pictured) harbour exotic lifeforms in their vicinity, on their surface, and even in their interior?

entry.title: an Australian wildlife conservationist (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an Australian wildlife conservationist has trapped and killed more than 1,450 feral cats?

entry.title: Chocolate Room (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the original exhibition of art installation Chocolate Room was shut down after attracting an "army of ants"?

entry.title: June Franklin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Iowa politician June Franklin wrote to ten members of the US Congress urging them to declare Martin Luther King Jr.'s birthday a federal holiday?

entry.title: an ancient Canadian archaeological site (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an ancient Canadian archaeological site was discovered during the construction of a dump?

entry.title: Chris Collier (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chris Collier is the first NFL player from his college in 37 years?

entry.title: Veto (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Veto, inspired by the history of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth, is considered to be the first Polish collectible card game?

entry.title: a man's body (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a man's body, found wearing only a woman's wedding ring and a pair of socks in 1971, is the oldest unsolved missing persons case in Staffordshire, England?

entry.title: Afrique Victime (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mdou Moctar's 2021 album Afrique Victime was distributed on pre-loaded Nokia 6120 classic cellphones?
